prompt:
---
name: Extract Elements of Text
description: Extract specific elements of text from a given text
source: OpenAI documentation
url: https://help.openai.com/en/articles/6654000-best-practices-for-prompt-engineering-with-the-openai-api
inputs: 
   text:
      type: string
---
system:
Extract the important entities mentioned in the text below. First extract all company names, then extract all people names, then extract specific topics which fit the content and finally extract general overarching themes

Desired format:
Company names: <comma_separated_list_of_company_names>
People names: -||-
Specific topics: -||-
General themes: -||-
user:
Text: {{ text }}
inputSpec:
The input is a string containing text, potentially mentioning company names, people names, specific topics, and general themes. 
The input text must be a coherent passage containing complete sentences. 
The input text can include names of companies. 
The input text can include names of people. 
The input text can include specific topics relevant to the content. 
The input text can include general themes overarching the content.
There are no specified restrictions on the length of the input text. 
The input text must be structured in a way that entities can be clearly identified.
rules: The output must begin with "Company names:" followed by a list of company names extracted from the text, separated by commas and no additional spaces between names.
Next, the output must continue with "People names:" followed by a list of people names extracted from the text, separated by commas and no additional spaces between names.

Then, the output must include "Specific topics:" followed by a list of specific topics that are relevant and directly mentioned in the text, separated by commas and no additional spaces between topics.
Finally, the output must conclude with "General themes:" followed by a list of broader, overarching themes identified from the text, also separated by commas with no additional spaces between themes.
Each section must be presented on a new line, starting with the specified label exactly as given, followed by a colon, and then the corresponding list.
The lists should always maintain the order specified in the system prompt and must not include any entries that are not present in the provided text or are irrelevant.
inverseRules: The output must not begin with "Company names:" and it should exclude any list of company names extracted from the text.
Next, the output must continue without "People names:" and avoid listing any people names extracted from the text.
Then, the output must exclude "Specific topics:" and should not list any specific topics relevant and mentioned in the text.
Finally, the output must not conclude with "General themes:" and should avoid listing broader, overarching themes identified from the text.
Each section must not be presented on a new line, avoiding the specified label exactly as given or a colon, and must not include any corresponding list entirely.
The lists should maintain no specific order and may include entries that are not present in the provided text or are irrelevant.
